other_tests.findings: Identified mutations in MAGED2 in each of the 13 infants with transient antenatal Bartter’s syndrome.
Initial severe polyhydramnios measured with an amniotic fluid index of greater than 24 cm, up to 98 cm observed.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The onset of polyhydramnios occurred earlier in fetuses with MAGED2 mutations than known types of antenatal Bartter’s syndrome, with progressive resolution of symptoms in surviving infants.

other_tests.date: Follow-up occurred at 2 years of age for one patient
other_tests.findings: The patient had normal tubular and glomerular function.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initial symptoms including progressive polyuria normalized within 1 week post-birth, and no clinical signs of renal salt loss were observed at 17 years of age.
